required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: MESO-CAR T Cells Therapy for Relapsed and Refractory Ovarian Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: A Clinical Trial of MESO-CAR T Cells Therapy for Relapsed and Refractory Ovarian Cancer

collaborator.agency: Second Affiliated Hospital, School of Medicine, Zhejiang University

brief_summary.textblock: The goal of this clinical trial is to study the feasibility and efficacy of anti-MESO antigen receptors (CARs) T cell therapy for relapsed and refractory ovarian cancer.

detailed_description.textblock:
Primary Objectives
1.To determine the feasibility ad safety of anti-MESO CAR-T cells in treating patients with MESO-positive ovarian cancer.
Secondary Objectives
1. To access the efficacy of anti-MESO CAR-T cells in patients with ovarian cancer.
2. To determine in vivo dynamics and persistency of anti- MESO CAR-T cells.

primary_outcome.measure: Safety measured by occurrence of study related adverse effects defined by NCI CTCAE 4.0

secondary_outcome.measure: Overall complete remission rate defined by the standard response criteria for malignant lymphoma for each arm
Duration of CAR-positive T cells in circulation
Detection of PD1 antibody in serum

arm_group.description: Administration with anti-MESO CAR-T cells in the MESO-positive ovarian cancer patients

intervention.description: Retroviral vector-transduced autologous T cells to express anti-MESO CARs

facility.name: The Second Affiliated hospital of Zhejiang University School of Medicine
